moves.1. e4 e5 2. f4: for some reason, I am starting to appreciate this: this opening is so ancient, that only modern players can crack it...
moves.2... d6: a sound reply: after Nf6, Black can play Bg4, and then there is Qh4+...
moves.3... Bg4: not many options here: White could try d3, g3, or just get this over with...
moves.7. Bc4: White needs to castle: this also hinders d6-d5...
moves.7... g5: an unexpected move: but White has to react in some way; losing f4 is not a real option, and also fxe5 and fxg5 look shady...
moves.8. f5: so we play this: this makes Blacks' position impenetrable for now, probably the reason he played this; it also opens up the DSB diagonal, after playing the d-pawn......
moves.8... Nc6 9. c3 Bg7 10. d3: at this point both players have to decide, whether to castle long or short...
moves.10... a6: here is a clue for White: Black is preparing b5, and take actions on the Queens' wing...
moves.11. Be3 Na5: giving Bc4  no means of escape: after c6, the Bishop gets trapped...
moves.12. Nd2: making the most of it: the Knight can recapture at c4 or b3; also development...
moves.12... b5: losing no time: Bd5 is not an option after c6...
moves.13... Nc6: very clever: now, the a-pawn will march: and Bd5 remains useless...
moves.14. d4: but there is something to be done...
moves.15. cxd4 Nd7: another unexpected move: opening a crossfire at d4...
moves.16... Qf6 17. e5 dxe5 18. Bd5 exd4 19. B: we need to snuff this out, before it gets bad: White is a pawn behind, and is losing momentum...
moves.25... Nd7: trying to make play: but White finds a way...
moves.26. Rd5 h5: after Rhd1, Black needs counterplay: but this is not it...
moves.28... Rhf8: forced: against Nf7, forking both rooks; after Rdf8, Bxc7+: in retrospect, hxg4 was best: Nd7 is lost anyway...
moves.29. Ne6: only to get forked in a worse way: now, four pieces are under attack...
moves.29... Rfh8: not sure, if this is the way out...
moves.32... Bd6: disrupting the rooks coordination for now, but this is mainly to cover against Rxc7+: maybe Black should have considered h4 or hxg5...
moves.33. g5: R1xd6 will not work: there is no direct mate, so we open up a new front; first, get the g-pawn covered...
moves.36. Rd1xd6: but now, this will work real nice...
